content: Seems to use Here maps with an overlay. What this means is that the maps have limited functionality, and will not redirect based on traffic, the way the turn by turn app does. All in all, a waste of money
Shows completely wrong directions.

You know there's a problem with an app if there has been no update in almost a year as well as it not being able to work on a galaxy S10 on a Duke 390 with 0km on the clock. Lucky I got a refund as it was pretty sad buying the bike from a KTM dealership and no one could get it working on any phone
Not useful... The navigation stops as soon as I keep my phone in pocket.

Feature request: 1) Ability to skip waypoint from bike switches rather than having to stop and skip via phone. 2) Traffic updates with re-route option. 3) Ability yo rotate to landscape. Other than that it has worked really well on a number of complex rideouts.
The map is pathetic. Could have done a better job. The map is horrible. Please allow entry of Latitude and Longitude. At least that helps us to find a place.
It's a great start, but needs a lot of work
The map is not accurate. It diverte small roads and return back the same place after a long distance travel
Tried it out on my new bike today and it worked perfectly using a Note 9 phone.

This app blows. I installed the free KTM my Ride and it did what it was supposed to do. Download KTM MY RIDE navigation and nada. Zip. Zero. Zilch. It pairs with my phone but doesn't automatically link to any maps I use on my phone including Waze and Google maps. With the sophistication of these machines and their components these apps should be able to display temps to Can you fix it so a bone head like me can hook it up in a few key strokes? PFG South Boston 2020 390 not yet broken in Duke
Worst app I bought for 600 rs.. Wasted money.
Completely useless. Navigation worked once and now freezes after the first turn. You'd expect more from a premium brand. Not happy.
The navigation is not accurate. Distance shown and actual distance don't match. You are bound to miss turns if you depend solely on this navigation.
Works perfectly on Samsung Note 4 paired to 2019 1290 SAS, showing clear turn by turn directions with voice guidance.
Worked once, save your money

It will connect my phone and scarla for use with the bike controls, but the navigation is useless. It will not connect and display on my 2019 SAR. Better off with the free version and use google maps. Don't waste your money.
Keeps crashing on Samsung S20
Good on the bike but very basic. Would be great to interact with Calimoto
Worst app I don't know why I purchased.
Hopeless is an understatement for this app. Don't waste your money on it.
Works well with my SD1290r now the Bluetooth's been enabled at the latest software update. Connects every time so far.
Works fine with my Super Adventure S but desperately needs LANDSCAPE mode please!!!

The app works fine on my Huawei Mate 10 Pro. For some reason, it does not work unless it is allowed access to location even when the app closed. The option to allow access only while app is in use is offered during set-up, but the app ceases to function if it is selected. Truth be told, I'll probably only use this app until I can get a good mount for my smartphone, at which point I will go back to Google Maps. The app is expensive considering alternatives like Android Auto are free.

App does work and is better than nothing. But incredibly disappointing from a company that wants to be considered a premium brand. Its even worse than BMW's nav app. Actually, this makes the BMW app look good. Stunning that you have to download 6GB to have the USA maps, which are required if you routinely slip cellphone coverage. I want 3 states, not 50. KTM should be embarrassed over this app. They could do so much better.

Worked once on Samsung S20 Ultra, but then never again. Had to swap to old Same Note 8 to get it to work. Very annoyed, as seamless Satnav is expected on such an expensive bike (Super adventure 1290 r). BMW anyone? Come KTM, sort it out!
App stops working when the phone is locked
Useless app. Just hangs up on my phone once i enter a destination. Doesnt decrease the distance to be covered even if i go ahead. Overall waste of money.

Works ok but..... .... Very limited routing options. If you could import a GPX track (or similar) it'd be great. As it is, ok for finding places and getting to them but almost no choice how you get there
Does not connect to my 2019 KTM Adventure R, even after dealer confirmed that my dashboard firmware is up to date.
This works okay. Can we get landscape mode for this?
The app is ok but the maps for New Zealand are faulty. I found two roads are are broken there for I am unable to create a route correctly.
Terrible...I could never get it to work
Great idea. Terrible execution.
Offline maps is just useless. I m running it on a 390 adv btw. Also when I connect it to my phone, the keyboard doesn't pop up for searching a location. Ktm India pls address this issue.
doesn't work, wont even pair with new 2019 adventure 1290 s, rip-off

Needs accuracy W.R.T location and destination. Also transmission of data from the phone to the display has to be more accurate and faster as a little delay might direct you to another turn of it's not fast.
Does not work at all with my 2020 390 adventure and android note 10 + a waste of time and cost of app.
Cannot download maps. Not very flexible or user friendly.
This constantly locks up. Cant be trusted to stay working long enough to for any kind distance ride. Great idea, hope it gets fixed SOON!
Crashes every now and then. Completely useless. Would have bought a mount for the price spent on this app.

Base idea is great, but maps and routing done by the app is pointless. You can't choose winding road route ant the direction that comes up on ktms dashboard are laging. Routing is also questionable. App should improve directions speed on the dash and use something like google maps, tom tom or calimoto route engine.
Although my phone is connected to the bike still says no bike connected?
App isn't working........again.
Will not connect to my 390 duke

We will be FINED........ Found a issue, navigation stops suddenly for a update. Even when you're riding. Directions which it is showing is for car, Come on HERE maps we bought for a bike not every direction will be for bikes. Due this wrong directions we will be fined heavily from police....
Not happy with the app
I have a 2019 KTM 390 Duke. I am willing to pay for this upgrade to use navigation on my KTM. Is this option available to me?

Hopeless once paired as soon as you switch the ignition off it forgets the pairing to Samsung S9 and my inter phone urban head set apparently they are not on the tested and approved list.come on KTM you can do better than this? How do I get my money back?

Malfunctioning a lot. Worked only once. Very disappointed! Problem with the app. The developer should fix the issues. It shows the preview but when i start navigation it'll show 0(zero) kilometres and no time of arrival. Please resolve the issue ASAP
Works perfectly for me especially after I downloaded the map of the USA. No complaints
Works perfectly ever time on my 1290
Useless
Works perfectly in Singapore. Works on my KTM 390 Adventure. Rerouting is fast. Easy to use. As per Feb 2020, map is updated. Developers need to allow rider to choose fastest route.
Best in class

Don't buy this app is a joke and quite frankly unusable.KTM knows it and they just don't care.Look what BMW's app can do.Connects properly with MI 9T Pro but the app is flawed because of two main reasons: 1.Navigation is too slow on the 1290 Adv dash and as a result you miss the turn and the it starts rerouting which is again waaay too slow. 2.Doesn't use Google maps
Did not work at all 2019 ktm duke

KTM ruins their reputation with this. KTM needs to get a refund from whatever useless cad developed this navigation app. Here's a clue, a navigation app is supposed to give you directions from one place to another. This provides exactly the wrong direction in almost every use. Imagine replying on this on a long trip. I'm complaining to Google play about fraud in this case because it's just that bad. Do not waste $10 on this app. I have a brand new ktm adventure 790. This app is garbage.
I would like to mark a position

It was about time I upgraded my review because all issues from my previous one have been solved. The app is convenient and the link to the display works without problems now. Sometimes the navigation gets it wrong, but this happens with all systems.

Navigation works on 1290 s but it's pointless paying for something that's just showing the direction. I can't skip music or answer phone calls because I ride with earphones (bike ask for Bluetooth headset) .... I thought it was worth it but I'm better off listening to music and Google maps in the background telling me where to go..... Such a waste of money

Se desconecta continuamente... No es fiable. Practicamente imposible que recalcule la ruta de manera rapida... Habria qu√© mejorar muuuucho la App para ponerse al nivel de otras marcas. Ya entiendo por qu√© no se promociona en los concesionarios.

The app is working as a very basic navi + 1 star, the maps are ok + 1 star but this is everything. There is no way to do any changes through the handlebar (e.g. skip a waypoint) during the ride. Not offering petrol stations, if the fuel is getting low, no route import... A manufacturer from Bavaria has these features. My satisfaction has room to get improved. Dear KTM, please take this as a challange üòâ
Works ok
Give this app for Duke 390 also you have already launched Duke 390 adevnture it's better if it comes in 390
Does not work. I want my money back KTM

So..... After emailing several times and receiving no response I found that YouTube was more helpful than the developers. Each address entered you must pick the options for tolls/ main roads etc. Why make it so hard? Why not just have a settings menu with all the options in it. Once I worked that out I found that the app works pretty well.

Freezes every single time I use it, requiring a stop and reset. No other navigation app I use does this. Phone also gets very hot using this app. Has shut the phone down on a couple of occasions due to heat. A big waste of money for me. Much easier to get a decent phone mount above the dash and use any other app instead.

Last for about 5 minutes and then it looses connection towards the app. Ive even let the app have full background activity without interfering with battery life saving stuff. Pretty useless currently, also worth noting that the maps itself is based on 'Here' maps. No responses when emailing the dev contact here on playstore to try and give more detailed feedback update: ended up going to the 1000km service and getting software update on the bike (KTM 790 Adventure) and still didn't fix above.

Unreliable, it will just sort of stop updating. Missed my turn by several miles several times. Not up to KTM quality standards. I am hopeful for further improvements. I would like to be able to load a GPX track for my ADV bike, or just have it show me what Google maps directions is doing. 790 Adventure R with Galaxy S6.
Folks does this App not support Landscape format? it's quite inconvenient.
App will not connect to 2017 superduke R

I have only used this for nav to date. Works fine (790 Adventure and Pixel2) but light on features. I cannot upload my own route (GPX or otherwise), I don't see how to get offline maps loaded (I don't need the entire USA!), and some turn/exit names in the app are not the same as IRL so unfamiliar areas can be problematic.  It does not want access to my contacts so I can't select a person and have it figure out where they live. It is not a possible app to use when accessing a map reference. So integration within the phone ecosystem is non-existent.  Lacking these features means it is only usable in situations where the app finds the route I actually want to follow using its somewhat lame search interface. Overall, frankly, if I need a visual map I'm more likely to use Google or another app which is more featureful. Wish it were improved.

We're getting there. So today my 1290 SAS had a service and there was a major software update done. The KTM My Ride function now works faultlessly, very well. Thank you KTM, all you need to do now is use a decent mapping platform. "Here" mapping has a latency which leads to confusion.

destroys any and all battery power as I cant put the app to sleep so it always runs in the background. finally uninstalled it and have my battery back again. come on ktm! I expect so much more from a company like you.
not working
I have to re-connect the phone to the bike every time so not too impressed
have to pair it evertime I start up the bike ktm 1290 adventure R

At least the app now works and will stay connected now the bike has had a software update, however this app for navigation music and phone is still well behind the Zumo navigation I had on my BMW 10years ago. It is the most basic of navigation and certainly not an app I would buy if I didnt have a KTM. You are supposed to be able to control things from your handle bars, but you can not alter anything on the navigation to give you alternative routes due to traffic or change to riding on a motorway. There is so much that could be done but this app at ¬£7.00 is having a negative impact on a ¬£17,000 bike

phone and headset need to be paired everytime I start my bike. Turn by turn is ok they should not have built their own app and they charge for. It doesn't work. When trying to get direction I need to enable highway and toll roads if you don't there is no route found error. Poorly thought out app and feature.
No way i can see to import a .gpx file, and the offline map feature is not working on my Moto X4.
No real issues to report, it's working well. Thanks Ktm, for fixing all the issues. This truly adds to the pleasure, of riding a Ktm.

The first time you pare with your phone and headset it works great, But turn off the bike or phone or headset and you will have clear everything and start over.   Really nice when it works , just too much trouble to deal with every time you   stop the bike. Update 6/24/19  Having had the software updated on my bike. The app is working much better. Before every time I shut the bike down It would lose connection and would have to go through the whole procedure , start the app turn on bluetooth on the phone and cycle my head set.  Now even if the bike has been turned off for several hours as soon as I turn the bike on it reconnects. And as long as I don't turn off the app or bluetooth on my phone it will reconnect.  KTM still needs to open the bike up to other maps (GOOGLE MAPS , WAYS, GARMIN GPS'S) THEY CAN DO IT. Bmw uses the same hardware and software (Bosch) on there bike's and they allow this.

I bought this bike because I was excited about the connectivity. What a huge mistake. NEVER stays connected and the maps SUCK! I wish so bad I had bought a BMW! Also defaults to avoid highway every time.
please add an option where you can disable the ktm dealership pinpoints in the map.
Bluetooth connection keeps dropping out so sat nav stops and the sat nav itself isn't great. Calls roads by wrong names, odd route choice etc. Expected better
please please please, fix the app so it can display in portrait mode..
I use it without audio, it works great.

works perfectly on my Samsung galaxy s8 with ktm adventure 790. turn by turn shows up on my ktm dashboard. I haven't got the sound working through my scala rider headset yet however but that's probably my settings needing adjusted. my only complaint is that I wish it would give you a heads up of the turn after your next turn, as sometimes it's too slow if you have 2 turns one straight after another. but all in all working perfect for me
Shows the route... And then "can not find route" when you start the navigation.

Not much you can say just hangs on my S7 so totally useless. Works better on Moto G6 still not fabulous but i reckon some of that is due to the Bluetooth stack on the 1290 Super Adventure. KTM need to fo some work on getting this sorted.

Great App. Take time to set it up. Follow the instructions and it works great. Lots of people have written that it doesn't work. Yes it is s bit fiddly at first but once your phone is paired it works everytime. The display on the TFT is great, directions spot on and I recommend it.
Please make google maps work on the bikes. That might be much better for Africa.
Works as intented but not very convenient. What about teaming up with the calimoto guys to create something awesome.
2018 Duke 390 - I can't believe KTM allows this to be sold. I had the same issues that other reviewers had and I'm disappointed since this was one of the main selling points for me.

Terrible App, great idea, such a shame. wasted ¬£7.99. started a 120km route after 3k it froze. pulled up and switched the bike off. everything disconnected had to repair packtalk and phone and restart app. after 5k it froze again. won't bother using again. how do I get my money back.
The bikes dashboard issues a passcode but nothing comes up on my phone for me to enter it. The bike then times out and says 'Pairing failed'. Completely unusable.
app doesn't work sat nav constantly dropping out and freezing, just bought a garmin. do not waste money on this app
Doesn't work

This app is not for the Superduke R. This is stated in the description but I failed to notice. Don't be a fool like me and pay for this if you own a SDR, your phone will not connect with your bike. Buy a tomtom instead if you want Navigation on a Superduke R.

Update: Tried the new version. Absolute Rubbish! Using a Samsung 8+ latest Firmware, Packtalk also with the latest firmware. Audio Quality is terrible. There is nothing good about this app. Initial Feedback: Alpha version at best. Needs some serious bug fixes. I don't even bother connecting it any more.
not working in my motorcycle please refund me the money
I can't even install it...
No audio. And with the Dec 18 update it will not connect at all. Rubbish. The feedback mail address does not work either!

It's an ok app, I expected more from KTM though. The connectivity is a bit tricky, but once I figured it out, it works as advertised. I have a Galaxy S7; the best sequence I found is to first, connect the headset to the bike, then connect headset to the phone, then connect phone to the bike. It's cumbersome to have to do this each time I wanna ride, hopefully the scheduled Q1 2019 update will address this issue. Hope this helps someone .

I don't know if it's the app or the bike but I have had no joy with KTM my ride. it will not re-connect with my phone after I turn off the bike. my phone can't connect with the bike unless I delete the pairing and start the whole process from scratch. I can't understand how KTM can allow this app to be sold, surely they must have done some testing before releasing it for sale. I am properly disappointed.
last update crashes in every LG phone (android 8).

This badly needs an overhaul.  Apart from being a bit buggy, why is there no easy way to switch between the nav and main info screen? Something like a long press on the back button?  BMW have had that on their system since day one.  Likewise being able to set other settings from your phone, e.g. set your favourites depending on the ride you are going on or the time of year.  Being able to put your phone in a holder (they sell powerparts phone holders) and have more info about the bike appear there would be great.  How about being able to adjust the shock preload yourself via the app with suggested settings for different rider weights?  That would save the dealers a lot of hassle.  I'd be happy to beta test any of this. :)
The app has not been updated for a long time. Great idea but it needs to be developed further. Needs to be updated
Don't reconnect. Rudimentary functions. Doesn't worth to pay. Samsung Note 8. Super Adventure 1290, 2018. y

Common guys ...by now you should know that KTM customers are unhappy with this purchased app due to the working thereof being too intermittent. Select offline maps once map is downloaded then says search not available ?
Tells me no bike connected even though both my bike and my phone indicate they are connected to each other

Apalling app for the price! Messaged the devs but they don't even bother to reply. I have a brand new bike with up to date software and this app still fails to connect 99% of the time. KTM need to get new developers on this as it could be excellent, untill then don't waste your money
Barely ever works, still unteliable
Had the ktm my ride up dated at my local dealer now it's worse it just freezes on the dash üëé
Doesn't recognize that my bike and my phone are conected, even though my ride connect says its connected. Totally broken
Just bought this for my duke 790, needless to say it's not compatible with my bike, even tho I have a my ride Bluetooth box fitted as an extra. Waste of ¬£7. Stick with Google maps....

Great app, but needs to have vehicle information, riding info, riding history recordings, favorite address record. Also bike needs some additonal updates for phones such as phone addressbook search and call from bike dashboard. Ducati and BMW Motorrad are good examples. Waiting for updates. To prevent connection problems, follow this steps: 1. Turn on your phone bluetooth 2. Start your bike dashboard or run it on n gear 3. Run KTM My Ride on your phone Then you will see your connection on app main screen. If you can not connect make a new connect and delete existing on the app. This will prevent misconnection Thanks.

Sadly, a similar story to most other reviews. Doesn't reconnect and hangs every time. Occasionally able to connect but it always freezes. Have only tried navigation. KTM Hemel said latest software is installed on the bike, nothing they could do. Especially bad as it costs quite a bit for an app. I have a Samsung Galaxy S9+ and a 1290 SAR. I'm hopeful that an update will fix the problem, surely this many disappointed customers can't just be ignored.

Navigation still won't show in TFT screen even with most recent update on 
1290 super adventure

It works well connecting to my bike. However, Nav is useless unless KTM let 
it able to get direction share from Google Maps. Nav does not recognise a 
lot of Indonesia's destination and roads. Let it use Google Maps! I 
should've paid $12.99 for nothing!

Again I cannot install the app on my phone so I have to reset it to get it 
connected. I reinstall it now for the 3rd time

KTM quality? Nope. Really great for about five minutes then glitchy, 
stuttering, nonsense. Can't reconnect when the bike restarts, doesn't 
recognise the bike next time around. Just paid ¬£7.99. I would.be 
disappointed if it were free. I am the world's biggest KTM fan and even I 
have to say complete rubbish.

It just doesnt work as advertised. Using Samsung Note 8 with 1290 SA S. 
Setting up was easy, phone to bike, bike to ScalarRider... but... here's 
the problems. 1) Reconnection is a pain. sometimes work, sometimes doesnt. 
Have to manually reconnect a few time for it to work. 2) When finally 
connected, it can stop any time. The navigation just freezes whenever it 
feels like. Totally useless. 3) The audio/music function also not 
seamless... have to manually play on the phone for music to start when 
startup. it doesnt connect and just play. But in fairness, that could be 
the player app that i use... however, the same phone works just fine with 
my cars (emphasis plural). so, more blame on KTM.

Looks great on phone, but unusable for nav. Works for a couple of turns 
then freezes. Updates occasionally while riding. Given up on it. How do KTM 
feel they can charge for this app?

It does bring up various route options like other motorbike motorbike sat 
nav. The app doesn't always connect to the bike.

After pairing for the first time it worked. Re-pairing was unsuccessful 
though. Struggled 20 min then to get Bluetooth connection again. Gave up 
after that. Samsung S7.

Randomly works fine, most of the time it says no bikes connected even if 
the bike is enough connected to play music....

Got the software update on my 2017 1290 SA and bought this app. Was a 
little fiddly to get connected properly but worked well when it did. Worked 
great testing for some runs. Yesterday when I actually needed it for a 200 
mile journey, even though Bluetooth was connected to the bike enough for a 
phonecall to come through, the app just would not recognise there being a 
bike connected! I tried turning things of and on, repairing them, clearing 
all the app data, nothing worked. Very frustrating having to stop a few 
times and look at Google maps to see where to go next when this thing was 
being so useless.

Not working after last update. I enter destination, press Start and it 
stucks with 0h 0m 0km arrival. Won't work either with my bike connected or 
without. Please fix it.

Linking to my bike is very temperamental. Now the app won't load, even 
after a reinstall.

Blue tooth is fine but the GPS very often dosent connect with my ktm 
dashboard very tough when you need it ... when I switch off my mobile and 
open again usually is connected

Dont know if it's the app or the bike but I have tried to use it maybe 12 times and only 2 worked with a lot of difficulty when it does work it's really cool but having it not work a 90% if not more I feel I wasted my money.  I was expecting more with the technology the bike has hope they fix it soon. But until then will need to keep on using my phone support :(
Most Bugs fixed fast . Maps for Au now provided. Great response team.  thank you üòÅ enjoying the App
